thread.title: Security Increased Around Oklahoma Ten Commandments Monument
thread.title_full: Security Increased Around Oklahoma Ten Commandments Monument

author: Associated Press
title: Security Increased Around Oklahoma Ten Commandments Monument
text:
Security Increased Around Oklahoma Ten Commandments Monument Posted: Ten Commandments monument OKLAHOMA CITY - 
The Oklahoma Highway Patrol is increasing security around a Ten Commandments monument at the state Capitol as a court-ordered deadline looms for the granite sculpture to be removed. 
Two uniformed troopers and squad cars were posted near the monument Monday on the north side of the Capitol. Barriers also had been erected around the six-foot-tall monument to keep visitors from getting close to it. 
After years of legal wrangling, the Oklahoma Supreme Court ruled in June that the monument's display violates a constitutional prohibition on the use of public property to support a "system of religion." 
The original monument was smashed to pieces last year when someone drove a car across the Capitol lawn and crashed into it. 
A judge ordered the monument be removed by Oct. 12. Special Features
